AUI

  • Changelog
  • Upgrade guide

Atlassian User Interface${project.version}

AUI is a tailor-made frontend library for creating a user interface according to the Atlassian Design Guidelines.

Getting started

Most Atlassian products have AUI installed as a plugin. The flat pack is great for prototyping or deploying in apps which can't load a plugin.

  • AUI repository on Bitbucket

Documentation

AUI provides JavaScript, CSS and Soy templates (or markup patterns) for a range of ready-made UI components.

  • API documentation

Serve from CDN

Using the CDN will make your pages load faster and resources won't be out of date.

Using AUI from CDN

Close

Core

Note that AUI supports jQuery 1.7.2 and 1.8.3 - alter the below jQuery script as required.

Download AUI

Download the static files and bundle it in your project like any other resources.

Download AUI

Close

What's included?

This zip file contains both core/stable components from AUI, plus some components with experimental APIs (in separate resources).

Download AUI

How to load AUI

If you want everything including AUI's dependencies, Experimental features and compiled-JS Soy templates, add this to the HEAD of your templates or page:

...remembering to update the path to point to the location of your copy. This is the recommended/default option.
